Class TagDetection

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.umich.eecs.april.tag.TagDetection

  • public class TagDetection
extends java.lang.Object
    Detect a tag.

    • Field Detail

      • good

        public boolean good
        Is the detection good enough?

      • obsCode

        public long obsCode
        Observed code.

      • code

        public long code
        Matched code.

      • id

        public int id
        What was the ID of the detected tag?

      • hammingDistance

        public int hammingDistance
        The hamming distance between the detected code and the true code.

      • rotation

        public int rotation
        How many 90 degree rotations were required to align the code.

      • p

        public double[][] p
        Position (in fractional pixel coordinates) of the detection. The points travel around counter clockwise around the target, always starting from the same corner of the tag. Dimensions [4][2].

      • cxy

        public double[] cxy
        Center of tag in pixel coordinates.

      • observedPerimeter

        public double observedPerimeter
        Measured in pixels, how long was the observed perimeter (i.e., excluding inferred perimeter which is used to connect incomplete quads).

      • homography

        public double[][] homography
        A 3x3 homography that computes pixel coordinates from tag-relative coordinates. Both the input and output coordinates are 2D homogenous vectors, with y = Hx. y are pixel coordinates, x are tag-relative coordinates. Tag coordinates span from (-1,-1) to (1,1). The orientation of the homography reflects the orientation of the target.

      • hxy

        public double[] hxy
        The homography is relative to image center, whose coordinates are below.
